thread.section_title: Texas Rangers News, Schedule Scores: Dallas Morning News
thread.title: Three takeaways: Rua homers, Darvish finishes short of planned two innings during Rangers win
thread.title_full: Three takeaways: Rua homers, Darvish finishes short of planned two innings during Rangers win

author: Gerry Fraley
title: Three takeaways: Rua homers, Darvish finishes short of planned two innings during Rangers win
text:
Staff   starting pitcher Yu Darvish (11) walks in the outfield during a spring training workout at the team's   Friday, February 24,   
SURPRISE, Ariz. -- Takeaways and observations from the Rangers' 6-4 win over Kansas City on Sunday: 
THREE TAKEAWAYS 
MIGHT VS. RIGHT: Ryan Rua hit a long two-run homer in the first inning against right-hander Kyle Zimmer. The Rangers expect to use Rua primarily against left-handers, but he had a .396 slugging percentage for 139 at-bats against right-handers last season. 
SURGE CONTINUES: Delino DeShields had another noteworthy offensive performance. He stole second in the first and properly executed a safety-squeeze bunt to drive in a run in the second. 
LOTS OF PITCHES: The Rangers planned on Yu Darvish getting through the first two innings on about 30 pitches. He had several deep counts and came out after 1 2/3 scoreless innings with 37 pitches. Darvish averaged a career-low 15.7 pitches per nine innings last season. 
THE BREAKDOWN 
The arms: RHP Mike Hauschild, the Rule 5 addition from Houston, worked two scoreless innings and struck out the side in the sixth. Hauschild is a ground-ball pitcher, but he averaged 7.7 strikeouts per nine innings in the Triple-A Pacific Coast League last season. ... In the fifth, LHP Andrew Faulkner jammed Mike Moustakas, a left-handed hitter, and retired him on a grounder. ... RHP Preston Claiborne, of Carrollton Newman Smith, came over from the minor-league camp and stranded an inherited runner while finishing the second. 
The bats: DH Shin-Soo Choo accounted for three outs in his first two at-bats. In the first, Choo struck out with a runner at third and none out. In the second, he grounded into a double play against LHP Scott Alexander. ... Andy Ibanez, brought in from the minor-league camp, homered as a pinch-hitter in the fifth. 
The gloves: In the second, 1B James Loney grabbed a hard-hit grounder by Raul Mondesi and threw out Christian Colon trying to score from third. ... In the third, RF Travis Snider made an ill-advised dive for a two-out sinking liner by Hunter Dozier, of Denton. Snider missed, and the ball went for a triple. 
The legs: In the first, CF Delino DeShields stole second and took third on a wild pitch that bounced a few feet up the third-base line. This Topic is Missing Your Voice. View Comments
